Giana Sacco, the visionary artist behind Occipital, is opening the doors of her art studio to fellow makers for an Artisan Market that will be a flurry of creative energy. From February 1-3, this gathering will serve as a vibrant platform for local artists to showcase their talents and for the community to indulge in the joy of art. I want to open up my art studio to fellow local artists and organize an event that would bring great fun to the community. A three-day Artisan Market felt perfect, giving access for the community to connect with each artisan, enjoying a unique day or night out with friends, and leaving with a one-of-a-kind piece, says Sacco, whose passion for art and community is the driving force behind this initiative. The Artisan Market, which will take place Thursday and Friday from 4-7pm, and Saturday 12-4pm, invites visitors to browse a curated selection of local artists, including The Jaded Candle, A Bushel and a Peck Floral Design, PMT Pottery, and RAHA Jewelry. Each artist brings a distinct flavor to the market, from the aromatic scents of hand-poured candles to the delicate beauty of custom floral designs, the earthy charm of ceramics, and the intricate craftsmanship of bespoke jewelry. For further details, visit their website at www.OccipitalNYC.com No comments on this item Please log in to comment by clicking here Other items that may interest you

June 1, 2024 March 28, 1947 - Jan. 14, 2024 Mr. Robert E. Starley, 76, of Gray, passed away Sunday, January 14, 2024. Funeral services will be at Hart’s Jones County Chapel, Thursday, January 18, 2024, at 2:00PM, with the Reverend John Haney and Care Pastor Chris Smarr officiating. Burial at Macon Memorial Park will follow the service. The family will greet friends at Hart’s Mortuary Jones County Chapel, Wednesday, January 17, 2024, from 5:00PM to 7:00PM. Born on March 28, 1947, in Dublin, Georgia, Mr. Starley was a man of honor and courage, having served his country as a Vietnam veteran in the U.S. Army. After his military service, Mr. Starley served as a fire and rescue volunteer for the Jones County EMA. He dedicated many years as a maintenance electrician and eventually retired from the Georgia Power Plant Scherer, where his work ethic and camaraderie were highly valued by all who knew him. Mr. Starley was a man whose love for life was as immense as his generosity and sense of humor. He was known for his quick wit and the laughter that often filled the rooms he entered. His jovial nature and propensity to share amusing anecdotes made him a beloved figure in his community and amongst his colleagues. A true friend to all creatures great and small, Mr. Starley had an extraordinary affinity for animals. He was often seen carrying treats for the various animals he encountered, and he generously fed those that came up to his house, providing a haven for the local wildlife. This compassion for animals was just one of the many ways he expressed his generous spirit. An avid outdoorsman, Mr. Starley found solace and joy in fishing, a pastime that allowed him to immerse himself in the tranquility of nature. He cherished these moments, often sharing them with family and friends, creating memories that would last a lifetime. Family was the cornerstone of Mr. Starley’s life, and he was deeply committed to those he loved. He nurtured a home filled with warmth and affection, where laughter was the common language, and kindness was the currency. His presence was a source of comfort and strength, and he will be dearly missed by all who had the pleasure of knowing him. Those who knew Mr. Starley will remember him as a funny and generous man. His ability to uplift others, his unwavering kindness, and his infectious humor have left an indelible mark on the hearts of many. As we bid farewell to Robert E. Starley, we celebrate a life well-lived, a legacy of joy, and the countless moments of laughter and kindness he bestowed upon us. May he rest in peace, knowing that his memory will continue to inspire and bring smiles to the faces of those he left behind. Mr. Starley is preceded in death by his brother, James Franklin Starley. He is survived by his wife of fifty years, Kim Starley; brother, Cecil Starley (Pat of Gray; nieces, Amy Starley Parker of Gray and Christy Starley Holliman (Chad of Thomaston, Georgia; numerous great-nieces, greatnephews, and cousins; and his faithful canine companion, Duke. In lieu of flowers, memorial contributions may be made to St. Jude’s Children’s Hospital at www.stjude.org/donate. Please visit www. hartsmort.com to express condolences. Hart’s Jones County Chapel, Hart’s Mortuary and Cremation Center, 307 Pecan Lane, Gray, GA 31032, has charge of arrangements. The Jones County News 102 Stewart Ave. P.O. Box 1538 Gray, GA 31032 (478 986-3929 © 2024 Jones County News

Leader & Times was an online magazine that covered news, events, and community happenings in Liberal, Kansas, and the surrounding area. The magazine was previously known as The High Plains Daily Leader, which was founded in late 1990s and had served the Liberal community for many years. In recent years, the publication had shifted its focus to online news coverage and had been using the name Leader & Times as its primary branding. The publication covered a range of topics, including local government, business, education, sports, and community events. The magazine had a strong focus on local news and events and had won several awards for its coverage of community issues and events. In addition to its online presence, Leader & Times used to publish a print edition twice a week, which was distributed throughout the Liberal area. The subscription price for the print edition started at $101.45 per year for residents of Liberal, and interested individuals outside of the city would have to pay $140 per year. Although Leader & Times was the primary name of the publication, The High Plains Daily Leader name was still in use in some areas of the publication s website and had been used interchangeably with the current name. Overall, Leader & Times was a well-respected source of news and information for the Liberal, Kansas community, and was dedicated to providing accurate and reliable local news coverage to its readers. Did you know that Southern University was once the leading producer of African American engineers in the country? Discussion regarding the plan to return the college back to its prominence was the topic of the Presidential Leadership Roundtable on Tuesday March 26th. Held in Pinchback Hall, … In a world that often seems to function on a monochromatic spectrum, I find solace and joy in being unapologetically Black, especially within the vibrant tapestry of HBCU culture at Southern University and A&M College. There s an unspoken magic that comes with strutting through the campus, draped in the rich hues of melanin, and I wouldn t trade it for anything. Firstly, let s address the undeniable fact that Southern University is the epitome of Black excellence. We ve got a campus that s practically a runway of melanin goddesses and gods, making every stroll to class a living, breathing fashion show. Who needs Milan Fashion Week when you ve got the bold and beautiful styles of Pretty Wednesday parading across the yard? Now, let s talk about the unspoken language we share. It s like being part of a secret society where every nod, dap, and what s good? carries the weight of a thousand cultural connections. You can t walk through the Student Union without catching vibes that feel like a family reunion. It s as if our ancestors are throwing us a spiritual pep rally, cheering us on with every step. And oh, the culinary delights that surround us! Southern University has its own flavor profile that could put any Michelin-starred restaurant to shame. Well, maybe not that good, but Red Bean Monday slaps! And those Tony burgers definitely get you through your days on the Bluff. Let s not forget the unapologetic discussions in classrooms that celebrate our voices. (In most cases In the hallowed halls of Southern University, we don t just study history; we shape it. It s a place where our narratives aren t footnotes but the main chapters, where we re encouraged to speak up, speak out, and challenge the status quo with an unyielding sense of self. As long as it’s not against our own administration, then you’re good to go. Being unapologetically Black at Southern University means embracing the resiliency that flows through our veins like an unstoppable current. It s recognizing that our presence on this campus isn t just a statement; it s a celebration. We don t tiptoe around our Blackness; we march to the rhythm of our ancestors, leaving an indelible mark on the legacy of Southern University. So, as I navigate the halls of this illustrious institution, I do so with my head held high, my stride purposeful, and my Blackness unapologetic. Because in the grand mosaic of life, Southern University is the vibrant brushstroke that paints a picture of unfiltered Black joy and excellence. And who wouldn t want to be part of that masterpiece? I could probably name a few people, but they don’t go to Southern, so that makes them irrelevant anyway. Log In Keep it Clean. Armed with a camera and the intent to spread joy, Portland State Vanguard’s team roamed the PSU campus, seeking consent to photograph and interview students, faculty and staff. Little did they know that this mission went beyond showcasing the visual splendor around us. “We are going around campus and taking photos of things we find beautiful, and you are beautiful,” Vanguard reporters said. The reactions that followed were a kaleidoscope of emotions. For some, it was a moment of sheer delight, a spark of unexpected positivity which illuminated their day. “You made my day,” echoed through the air as people revealed the warmth of being acknowledged for the beauty they possessed. What struck us the most was the realization that a single word or a heartfelt compliment had the power to shift moods and brighten spirits. In a world often filled with challenges and stress, a simple acknowledgment of beauty acted as a beacon of light, cutting through the mundane and casting a glow on the recipient’s entire day. As we documented these encounters, we witnessed the magic unfold. Faces lit up, shoulders straightened and a newfound confidence emanated from those whom a positive word had touched. This photo story isn’t just about pretty pictures; it’s a celebration of the inherent beauty within us all. It’s a testament that kindness in the form of a compliment can create a ripple effect of positivity, reaching far beyond the initial exchange. Let us remember the impact of a single word in a world that often rushes past the small moments. By genuinely recognizing and appreciating the beauty around us, we can make a lasting difference in someone’s day—one compliment at a time. See the video of the experience here. Updated: June 2, 2024 @ 12:24 am The U.S. Department of Agriculture’s Forest Service has released of the Pacific Northwest National Scenic Trail Comprehensive Plan which marks a significant milestone in the development and preservation of this iconic trail. The plan outlines a vision for the trail and provides guidance for its future management, protection, and use. The comprehensive plan guides the development of the nonmotorized trail throughout its entire length, from the Continental Divide to the Pacific Ocean. The plan contains recommendations for trail maintenance, visitor services, and resource protection, as well as strategies for addressing issues such as invasive species, wildfire, and climate change. It includes items defined by the National Trails System Act for consistent administration of the trail across local, state, federal, and tribal lands to ensure managers develop the trail and preserve its natural beauty. “With the comprehensive plan in place, new trail locations can be studied, and new trail segments will be constructed as conditions allow,” said Liz Berger, Acting Regional Forester for the Pacific Northwest Region of the Forest Service. “This will enable the trail to evolve and adapt to changing needs and environmental considerations, ensuring its sustainability for future generations.” The development of the comprehensive plan involved a collaborative process that included input from a wide range of stakeholders, such as trail users, local communities, conservation groups and the Pacific Northwest National Scenic Trail Advisory Council. The Forest Service gathered public input on the plan and environmental analysis during a scoping comment period from September 29 to November 14, 2022, a draft comprehensive plan and environmental assessment public comment period from March 17 to April 17, 2023, and objection resolution meeting in October 2023. The public s input was instrumental in shaping the final comprehensive plan, ensuring that it reflects the needs and aspirations of various stakeholders. This comprehensive plan is the result of a collective effort that involved input from a wide range of stakeholders, said Sally Butts, Director, Recreation, Lands, and Minerals for the Pacific Northwest Region of the Forest Service. We are committed to protecting and managing the Pacific Northwest National Scenic Trail and are confident that the plan will provide a roadmap for the trail s management, protection, and use for years to come. The plan is not only a blueprint for the trail s completion, but also a tool for conservation across the region. It will provide new protections for the landscape and support shared stewardship, ensuring that the trail experience it provides will receive proper protections. The plan will define the future vision for administration and management of the trail, ensuring consistent management and protection from one end to the other. The completion of the Pacific Northwest National Scenic Trail Comprehensive Plan is a testament to the dedication and collaborative effort of all stakeholders involved in its development. It represents a critical step forward in the preservation and responsible management of this trail, which holds immense value for both recreational opportunities and conservation efforts across the region. The Pacific Northwest National Scenic Trail is a 1,200-mile hiking trail that starts in Glacier National Park in Montana, crosses through northern Idaho, and finishes in Olympic National Park in Washington. It was designated by Congress as part of the National Trails System in 2009. The trail provides opportunities for long-distance, non-motorized recreation with portions of the trail located in remote areas that require bushwhacking with no trail. For more information about the Pacific Northwest National Scenic Trail Comprehensive Plan, visit https: www.fs.usda.gov/pnt. In the vast realm of online visibility, Search Engine Optimization (SEO plays a pivotal role in determining the success of a website. While many businesses opt for professional SEO services, there’s a growing trend of DIY SEO. Should You Do Your SEO Site? In this article, we’ll explore the pros and cons of taking the DIY SEO site route in boosting your online presence. Pro: Empowerment and Control One of the most appealing aspects of DIY SEO is the sense of empowerment and control it provides. When you’re the captain of your SEO ship, you have the freedom to make strategic decisions, implement changes promptly, and tailor your strategies according to the evolving needs of your business. Pro: Cost-Effective Approach For budget-conscious businesses, the allure of DIY SEO lies in its cost-effectiveness. By learning the basics and implementing strategies independently, you can save a significant amount compared to hiring professional SEO services. Numerous online resources and tools are available for free or at a fraction of the cost, making it feasible for small businesses or startups with limited financial resources. Pro: In-Depth Understanding of Your Business Embarking on the journey of DIY SEO forces you to delve deep into the intricacies of your business. You become intimately familiar with your target audience, industry trends, and the unique selling points of your products or services. This profound understanding can contribute not only to your SEO efforts but also to overall business strategies and decision-making processes. Con: Time-Consuming Learning Curve However, the DIY path is not without its challenges. A significant drawback is the steep learning curve associated with SEO. Google’s algorithms and ranking factors are ever-evolving, and staying abreast of these changes requires continuous education. For those with time constraints or a need for quick results, the learning curve can be a significant impediment, potentially leading to suboptimal outcomes. Con: Limited Resources and Expertise Another potential downside of DIY SEO is the limitation in resources and expertise. SEO is a multifaceted field that requires a diverse skill set, including technical know-how, content creation, and analytical abilities. Without access to a team of specialists, you may find it challenging to compete with businesses that invest in professional SEO services, especially in highly competitive markets. Con: Risks of Inconsistent Implementation Consistency is key in the realm of SEO, and this is where DIY efforts may face a stumbling block. Implementing SEO strategies sporadically or inconsistently can result in suboptimal results. Google’s algorithms favor websites with a consistent and well-maintained online presence. DIY practitioners may find it challenging to adhere to a rigorous schedule, leading to missed opportunities and a potential drop in search engine rankings. Conclusion: Should You Do Your SEO Site? In weighing the pros and cons of DIY SEO, businesses must strike a balance between empowerment and challenges. While the autonomy and cost-effectiveness are appealing, the learning curve and potential inconsistencies warrant careful consideration. Whether opting for a solo journey or seeking professional aid, success lies in a strategic, well-informed approach tailored to your business needs. Are you in the market for garage cabinets? If so, there are a few factors you’ll want to take into account before making your purchase. In this blog post, we’ll discuss some of the most important considerations to keep in mind when shopping for OC garage cabinets. Garage cabinets are a great way to keep your garage organized and tidy. But before you go out and buy a bunch of cabinets, it’s important to think about what you’ll be storing in them. Here are a few things to consider: Do You Need to Store Large or Small Items? If you’re planning on storing larger items like bikes or lawn equipment, you’ll need to make sure the cabinets you choose are big enough. On the other hand, if you’re just looking for a place to store smaller items like tools and gardening supplies, you can probably get away with smaller cabinets. Do You Need to Access the Items Often? If you’re planning on storing items that you’ll need to access frequently, it’s important to choose cabinets that are easy to reach. Taller cabinets can be difficult to access, so they’re better suited for items that you won’t need to get at often. Shorter cabinets, on the other hand, are more convenient for everyday items. What Kind of Climate Do You Live In? If you live in an area with high humidity levels, it’s important to choose garage cabinets that are made from materials that won’t rust or corrode. Metal cabinets are a good choice for this purpose. If you live in a drier climate, however, wood cabinets may be a better option. How Will You Use Your Garage Cabinets? Garage cabinets are a great way to keep your garage organized and tidy. But how will you use your garage cabinets? Here are some ideas: What is Your Budget for the Cabinets? There are many factors to consider when budgeting for garage cabinets, such as the size of your garage, the number of cabinets you need, and the type of cabinets you want. The first step is to measure your garage so you know how much space you have to work with. Then, decide how many cabinets you need and what type of cabinets would best suit your needs. Once you have an idea of what you need, you can start shopping around or start building your garage cabinets. February 08, 2024 Feature » Opinion Welcome to a new world of celebration – sober partying on the East Coast. If you re in recovery from addiction, this doesn t mean you re sidelined from the fun. Quite the opposite! This guide is tailored for you, offering ways to revel in social events and music festivals, all while steadfastly maintaining your sobriety. Let s explore how you can enjoy these experiences to the fullest. While battling addiction often involves a variety of treatment methods, integrating music therapy during addiction treatment has shown to be particularly beneficial. Of course, music therapy shouldn’t be the sole focus. It should be accompanied by other treatment strategies to achieve long-term sobriety. However, rehab centers in Pennsylvania note that listening to music, singing, dancing, and even creating music can greatly impact your recovery. Here are some of the benefits: Emotional Processing and Expression: Individuals recovering from addiction often struggle with feelings that they might find difficult to articulate. Music can help them express these emotions without the need for words. This emotional release is vital for healing and long-term recovery. Stress Reduction: As you probably know, stress is a common trigger for relapse, so having a way to manage it is crucial for maintaining sobriety. Engaging in musical activities can induce relaxation and lower anxiety levels. Improved Mental Health: Music therapy can boost mood and provide relief from symptoms of depression and anxiety, which are often co-occurring issues with addiction. By improving overall mental health, the risk of relapse decreases. Enhanced Cognitive Functioning: Addiction can impair cognitive functions over time. Music therapy helps rehabilitate these functions by engaging different parts of the brain. For example, learning to play a new instrument can improve concentration, memory, and problem-solving skills. Developing Healthy Coping Mechanisms: Music therapy can teach individuals healthy ways to cope with negative emotions or challenging situations. Instead of turning to substances, they can use music as a source of comfort and stability. Sober partying, also known as conscious clubbing, is a great option for people in recovery. Usually, when people who don t use substances go out, they end up in places where everyone else is using them. Therefore, it can be hard to find places to have fun without drugs or alcohol. However, conscious clubbing events don t have alcohol or drugs, making them a safe space for making friends and feeling good. Researchers talked to people between 25 and 55 years old from different parts of Europe who went to these events. They found that these events help people feel better and grow and help those who are trying to stay away from substances. Unfortunately, since this is an emerging trend, big festivals haven’t yet caught up with it. Therefore, you can only find a few well-known examples in the US, such as Sober Fest in Houston, Texas, and Sundown Colorado in Denver, Colorado. But don’t worry; soon, you’ll have more events like these to choose from. However, until then, you shouldn’t avoid your favorite music festivals because sober partying on the East Coast is possible. Look at the following tips for the ultimate concert experience without any substances. A sober friend can be an invaluable source of support when attending music festivals. They know your recovery journey and can guide you during difficult situations. Therefore, plan to attend these events with someone from your support group or a sober friend who shares your enthusiasm for music. This way, you ll have a dependable companion who can help you avoid substances and enhance your overall experience by enjoying the music together. Increasing awareness of the sober partying trend has led many music festivals to offer sober tents and alcohol-free zones. These areas often host activities like group meditations, non-alcoholic mixology classes, or even sober dance parties. It’s a fantastic way to enjoy the festival vibes without the temptation. Engaging with sober communities is a fantastic way to enhance your experience at music festivals. Consider joining groups like The Phoenix, a cost-free and sober active community that supports individuals on their recovery journeys. Through group activities and the power of human connection, such communities provide a strong network of friends who understand the challenges of addiction and can offer the support you need. Once you get to know the members, you can meet them at the festivals you want to attend for a great sober partying experience. Engaging in healthy habits for better physical health, mental health, and cognitive function is extremely important for your recovery. However, it’s easy to get overwhelmed by the festival atmosphere. Therefore, you should regularly check in with yourself. Are you feeling anxious? Take a moment and practice mindfulness or deep breathing. Remember, your mental and emotional well-being is key. You must always have a clear exit plan in place. Be aware of your limits and recognize when to step away from a situation that might challenge your recovery. If you can, arrange for your transportation in advance or have a ride-share app ready on your phone. Your ultimate priority should always be your sobriety and safety, so don t hesitate to use your exit strategy if you feel uncomfortable or in a compromising situation. Immerse yourself in the music; let it become the driving force behind your enjoyment. Live performances are a unique opportunity to experience the magic of music, so fully engage in them. Also, remind yourself that the primary purpose of your presence at the event is to savor the music, not to get caught up in the party atmosphere. By focusing on the melodies and rhythms, you can derive immense joy and exhilaration from the music without needing substances. Unfortunately, big music festivals can be very triggering, and the tips mentioned above are sometimes insufficient. Thus, if you ever feel overwhelmed or find your sobriety at risk, don’t hesitate to seek professional help. Contacting your therapist or a support group or even considering a return to rehab is not a failure. It s a brave and necessary step in your journey. Should you be in need of rehab in Pennsylvania, Little Creek Recovery can provide the help you need. This rehab center employs a 12-step model as the foundation of its approach, providing a well-structured setting that caters to the unique needs of patients. A pivotal aspect of their recovery process emphasizes cultivating wholesome, sober relationships rooted in mutual trust, respect, and empathy. They strongly believe that embracing a fresh and healthful perspective on the world can result in a successful recovery journey. In conclusion, sober partying on the East Coast offers an exciting, fulfilling, and enriching experience. It’s about embracing the present, enjoying life, and celebrating without reliance on substances. So, keep this guide in mind as you explore the music festival scene, and have a great time. In the realm of casino gambling, luck is often perceived as a mystical energy capable of either blessing or bewitching a player. While superstitions and myths about luck in casino gambling abound, most lack a factual foundation. Let’s delve into prevalent superstitions and myths, dissecting their lack of grounding in reality. One of the enduring superstitions in gambling is the belief in lucky charms or rituals that can sway one’s luck at the casino. Whether clutching a lucky rabbit’s foot or performing pre-game rituals, many players follow these practices in hopes of boosting their winning odds. Nonetheless, there is no scientific basis for the notion that these charms or rituals affect casino game outcomes. Luck hinges not on external objects or actions but on mathematical probabilities and chance. A prevalent myth in gambling revolves around the concept of “hot” and “cold” streaks, with players believing that their fortune in a given moment is determined by winning or losing streaks. Although players can indeed go through phases of success or failure, these streaks are merely outcomes of random chance and statistical fluctuations. Each game stands alone, unaffected by preceding results. Past victories or losses hold no sway over future outcomes. Instead of ascribing streaks to luck, it is crucial to grasp that results are dictated by mathematical probabilities and chance occurrences. Some gamblers hold onto the belief that their betting timing or the spot where they gamble can sway their luck at the casino. Whether waiting for a specific time of day to play or selecting a particular seat at the blackjack table, these notions are steeped in superstition rather than reality. The outcomes of casino games aren’t swayed by external factors like timing or location but rather by precise mathematical algorithms and random number generators. Luck isn’t confined by time or place but is instead dictated by the principles of probability and chance. Although luck influences casino gambling, it doesn’t solely dictate success. By grasping the principles of probability and randomness, players can strategize to enhance their winning odds. Here are key tips for excelling in casino gaming: Before engaging in any casino game, invest time in acquainting yourself with the rules and strategies at play. Whether it entails mastering fundamental blackjack tactics or grasping the intricacies of roulette odds, knowledge serves as the cornerstone for informed choices and enhancing your likelihood of success. Proper management of your bankroll is vital for sustained success in casino gambling. Establish a budget for your gaming sessions and adhere to it, resisting the urge to chase losses or exceed your financial limits. By handling your bankroll prudently, you can relish gambling without jeopardizing your financial well-being. Casino games vary in their odds. While games like blackjack and baccarat provide favorable chances for players, others such as slots have a higher house edge. Prioritize playing games with lower house edges to enhance your long-term winning potential. During intense moments, emotions can cloud judgment, leading to hasty decisions. Yet, mastering discipline and self-control is paramount for fruitful gambling endeavors. Refrain from pursuing losses, recognize the right moment to step back, and liberate your choices from the grip of superstitions and fallacies while in the casino. Although luck may appear as a mysterious element in casino gambling, it is crucial to engage in the activity with a logical approach. By grasping the concepts of probability and randomness, dispelling superstitions and misconceptions, and embracing effective strategies, players can enhance their odds of success at the casino. Keep in mind, luck may fluctuate, yet knowledge and strategy stand as the genuine linchpins for sustained profitability in the realm of gambling. Mark Hamm’s family moved to Moore in 1952, and he has fond memories of a childhood filled with biking to local spots like McDonald’s and enjoying Saturday morning breakfasts. Hamm says Moore is not just a city; it’s a place where he grew up, formed lasting connections, and cultivated a deep sense of community. Hamm’s professional journey began with jobs at Del Rancho and Walmart. He later transitioned to a career in law enforcement, working as a detention deputy and patrolman with the Cleveland County Sheriff’s Department. His commitment to public service extended to roles with Toby Keith and the district attorney’s office before returning to his church’s custodial staff and security detail. Currently employed at the Oklahoma City Community College as part of their Campus Police Department. In 2012, Hamm ran for and won a seat on the city council. He says his decision to run was motivated by a genuine interest in local government and a desire to contribute to the city’s leadership. Over his three terms, he focused on harmonious collaboration, ensuring that the city’s growth and development were balanced and inclusive. His dedication to effective governance and community welfare set the stage for a decision to run for mayor. Hamm’s vision for Moore revolves around key pillars: infrastructure, public safety, and quality of life. Emphasizing the importance of responsible growth, he advocates for strategic investments in arterial streets, water infrastructure, and public safety facilities. Hamm believes in building a city that can accommodate future populations while maintaining its unique charm and identity. Hamm says Moore has a great need to invest in infrastructure to ensure the city’s sustained growth. He highlights recent voter-approved initiatives, such as the $49 million bond for arterial streets, as crucial steps in addressing Moore’s evolving needs. Addressing recent challenges in public safety, Hamm stresses the importance of maintaining a strong and well-trained police force. With a focus on preventing crime and fostering community relationships, he envisions a Moore where all residents feel safe, regardless of their background or neighborhood. Hamm also believes the city needs a dedicated training facility for police and fire personnel. Hamm’s vision for Moore also includes initiatives that enhance the overall quality of life in Moore. He expresses support for bike trails, multipurpose trails, and other recreational amenities that cater to the diverse interests of the city’s residents.

La Crosse Eau Claire Evening Anchor LA CROSSE (WKBT -- The La Crosse Public Education Foundation honored educators at a Grants Award Luncheon in the Cargill Room Friday afternoon. Each year the organization awards Gold Star Grants to teachers in the School District of La Crosse. The foundation says in 2023 it awarded $80,000 for 43 projects. Educators apply for the grants, and the recipients use the money to enhance classroom learning or teacher training programs. Kathie Tyser received the Distinguished Service Award and Patty Sprang won the Richard Swantz Leadership Award. COPYRIGHT 2024 BY NEWS 8 NOW/NEWS 8000. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED. Jennifer Aniston, born on Feb. 11, 1969, is an American actress renowned for her iconic role as Rachel Green on the popular TV series Friends (1994-2004 . (NBCU Photo Bank/NBCUniversal via Getty Images via Getty Images The sitcom Friends revolved around the lives, friendships and romantic entanglements of a group of six friends living in New York City. Pictured is the cast during season 1. (NBC/Getty Images Aniston s evolution from the beloved Rachel Green to a talented actress and producer has been nothing short of extraordinary. (20th Century-Fox/Getty Images The chemistry among the cast of Friends – Aniston, Courteney Cox, Lisa Kudrow, Matt LeBlanc, Matthew Perry and David Schwimmer – contributed significantly to the show s immense success. (Hulton Archive Aniston s portrayal of the fashionable and relatable Rachel Green endeared her to millions, earning Aniston numerous awards, including a Primetime Emmy and a Golden Globe. (Andrew Eccles/NBCU Photo Bank/NBCUniversal via Getty Images via Getty Images Aniston and Brad Pitt were married for five years, divorcing in 2005. (Ron Galella, Ltd./Ron Galella Collection via Getty Images In recent years, there have been public interactions and friendly reunions between Pitt and Aniston, sparking occasional rumors of a renewed friendship. (Kevin Winter/Getty Images Beyond her sitcom success in Friends, Aniston has ventured into a prosperous film career, starring in hits like Marley & Me and The Break-Up. (NBC The real-life friendship among Jennifer Aniston, Lisa Kudrow and Courteney Cox has become an integral part of the Friends legacy. (Getty Images Courteney Cox, Jennifer Aniston and Lisa Kudrow have remained close since Friends ended. (Gregg DeGuire/Getty Images for SAG-AFTRA Foundation Apart from her achievements in front of the camera, Aniston delved into the realm of production by co-founding Echo Films in 2008. (Steve Granitz/WireImage/Getty Images In her revealing Allure interview from December 2022, Aniston candidly shares her journey with IVF, and reflects on relationships and her commitment to embracing transparency, with the declaration of having nothing to hide. (Zoey Grossman Whether on-screen or off, Aniston s post-Friends journey has been full of remarkable achievements. (James Devaney/GC Images Renowned as an American actress and producer, Jennifer Aniston was introduced into Hollywood with her breakthrough in the 1993 film Leprechaun. However, she cemented her status as a household name through her unforgettable portrayal of Rachel Green in the TV sitcom Friends, a role that graced screens from 1994 to 2004. FRIENDS STAR JENNIFER ANISTON ENDURED SCRUTINY OVER BEING CHILDLESS AFTER BRAD PITT DIVORCE: BOOK Since her sitcom days, Aniston s stardom has only increased, featuring numerous blockbuster movies that collectively grossed an astounding $1.6 billion worldwide. Her performances have not only solidified her place as one of the highest-paid actresses in the world, but also earned her accolades, including a Primetime Emmy, a Golden Globe and two Screen Actors Guild awards. RED LION, Pa. — The parents of an elementary school student in the Red Lion School District have filed a lawsuit accusing the district of not reporting the sexual assault of a 5-year-old on a school bus, despite having knowledge of the alleged incident. The 5-year-old child was sexually assaulted by another student on a Red Lion school bus in October 2023, the lawsuit claims. The lawsuit, which was filed in U.S. District Court for the Middle District of Pennsylvania, also names Michael Langan, who was principal at Clearview Elementary School at the time of the alleged incident, for failing to report the abuse to ChildLine and for failing to put the victim and perpetrator on different school buses. As principal, Langan is required by state law to report instances of sexual abuse due to his status as a mandatory reporter, the lawsuit says. The lawsuit also accuses the school district of violating Title IX laws and of violating the victim s equal protection rights under the 14th Amendment of the U.S. Constitution. According to the lawsuit, the student accused of assaulting the victim had previously assaulted at least one other student in the past. Langan and other school district officials allegedly knew about the previous incident and also failed to report it, the lawsuit claims. The lawsuit also claims that the school district s inaction and negligence led to additional assaults against other students. District officials failed to adequately staff the school bus with monitors when they knew there was a student with a history of sexual assault on the bus, according to the lawsuit. The school bus driver also did not respond to the alleged sexual abuse, failed to report it, and took no action to separate the victim from the perpetrator while they rode on the bus, the lawsuit claims. The 5-year-old victim suffered emotional distress and experienced symptoms of post-traumatic stress, and their academic performance also suffered, according to the lawsuit. Langan and the school district were deliberately indifferent to sexual assault and harassment, and had actual knowledge of the alleged assaults but were deliberately indifferent, according to the lawsuit, which seeks at least $150,000 in damages. Red Lion School District made the following statement regarding the allegations: Red Lion Area School District was served with a civil complaint filed February 1, 2024, by the parents of a Clearview Elementary School student identified anonymously in the complaint as Jane Doe. While we typically do not comment on active litigation matters, we vehemently deny the salacious allegations set forth in the complaint. Student safety is of paramount importance to the Red Lion Area School District Board of School Directors, our administrators, teachers, and staff. We are committed to ensuring a safe school environment for all students, including while being transported to and from school. According to the Broome County District Attorney, a Binghamton man has pleaded guilty as a second felony offender to rape in the First Degree in Broome County Court. The announcement was made by Broome County District Attorney Paul Battisti, who commended the victim s courage and stressed the commitment to protecting the community s most vulnerable members, particularly youth. The Broome County District Attorney s office reports that Michael Gibson of Binghamton admitted to engaging in sexual intercourse with a victim under the age of thirteen in the summer of 2023. By pleading guilty as a second felony offender, Gibson acknowledged the consequences of his actions. The guilty plea indicates his acceptance of the charges and eliminates the need for a trial. Gibson is scheduled to appear in court on May 10, 2024, for sentencing. As a result of his guilty plea, it is anticipated that he will be sentenced to fifteen years in New York State Prison, followed by fifteen years of post-release supervision. Broome County District Attorney Paul Battisti expressed his sympathy and support for the victim and their family as they navigate the aftermath of the traumatic experience. While acknowledging that the past cannot be changed, Battisti said that he hopes that the victim and their family find solace in the knowledge that Gibson is being held accountable for his actions. The District Attorney s Office remains dedicated to ensuring the safety and well-being of vulnerable populations, particularly the youth. The Endicott Police Department led the investigation into the case, with assistance from the Crime Victims Assistance Center. Their dedication, expertise, and commitment to seeking justice played a crucial role in building a strong case against Michael Gibson. Gallery Credit: Dave Wheeler

Charlotte, Sarasota County, Florida – As the sun sets on this Christmas Eve, residents of Charlotte, Sarasota County, Florida eagerly await the arrival of the jolliest and most iconic figure of the holiday season – Santa Claus himself. Meteorologists and aviation enthusiasts are also closely monitoring the skies, keeping an eye out for any signs of Santa’s sleigh and reindeer-led convoy. The weather forecast for the evening is clear, with a perfect view of the stars and the moon, creating an ideal backdrop for Santa’s sleigh to make its grand appearance. As the clock ticks closer to midnight, the anticipation continues to mount, and the people of our area await the timeless and heartwarming sight of Santa Claus spreading Christmas cheer from high above. The community is ready to embrace the joy and magic of the season, making this Christmas Eve a night to remember in Charlotte, Sarasota County, Florida. Listen now For over 50 years, KANM has been the voice of the student body at Texas A&M University, providing a platform for students to show their passion for music. We focus on promoting music that transcends commercial taste, committing ourselves to creating a one-of-a-kind, cutting-edge experience to our listeners from around the world.The KANM community is home to hundreds of members, with each one expressing their appreciation for music in a unique way. All members are free to write pieces about their favorite albums or artists to be published on our Frequency blog or in our bi-annual zine, and our DJs have weekly shows with free-form formats that encompass a diverse range of genres, striving to curate the best playlists that offer both the latest and greatest in music.We re always looking for people who love music like we do. Listen in and join our community at KANM.ORG. As a fully student-run organization, we are devoted to fostering a vibrant and inclusive community, where people from all backgrounds can explore new sounds, connect with other music lovers, and become a part of something bigger. We believe that music has the power to transform lives and bring people together, and we aspire to use this power to grow a collective of creative individuals who embrace all forms of music.Whether you re into the top 40 or the fringes of the underground, a seasoned music aficionado or starting to discover your taste, or just a person who appreciates a good song, we welcome you to join us in our pursuit of the best of the best in music. KANM s programming is carefully hand-picked by real people. Our music directors receive submissions from members daily, and conduct Music Review Crew events, where members can suggest albums that they would like to hear on air - we re always growing our already vast collection of music that spans eras, styles, and traditions. We believe that this approach to curation allows for a uniquely eclectic listening experience.We also carry an expansive selection of CDs in our in-station music library, and encourage members to explore its contents, hoping to incentivize real music discovery within our organization. Through the support and dedication of our community, KANM has been able to establish a strong presence in Texas growing live music scene. We host the bi-annual Save the Music show, which showcases emerging artists from the Bryan/College Station area and beyond, and regularly publish articles discussing the most exciting and important performances in Texas.KANM also hosts in-house performances from local bands. This intimate setting allows for a deeper connection between artists and our community, fostering a sense of belonging and unity through the universal language of music. If you re an artist and you d like to record a live session with us, fill out this form to get in touch. This website was created and designed in 2023 by a team of KANM s own Charlotte Harrington 24, Isabella Little 24, Joy Mpagi 25, Joey Quismorio 23, Liam Ramsey 24, Eren Rudd 24, Sam Torres 24, and Nayab Warach 26.The current webmasters include Mariel Salomon 26 and Tayla Diza 26, who maintain and manage the content and design of the website. They can be reached at webmaster@kanm.org. © 2024 KANM Student Radio, Texas A&M University. All rights reserved.

The Brenham Fire Department responded to four calls, which included three automobile accidents, and an illegal burning on Friday. Brenham Firefighters were dispatched to the 2600 Block of Mustang Road at 8:55am. A BFD unit arrived on the location to find a two-vehicle accident. Firefighters checked for fluids and injuries. No fluids were leaking, so they returned to service. Brenham Firefighters were next sent to another accident on Highway 290 West at Old Mill Creek Road at 4:15pm. Like the previous call, they checked for fluids and injuries. No fluids were leaking, so they returned to service. The Brenham Fire Department was later sent to a residence in the 300 block of West Bryan Street at 7:05pm for a report of illegal burning. BFD units arrived on the scene and found a homeowner was doing some burning in the backyard. The homeowner was informed that there is no burning allowed in the city limits, and so the fire had to be extinguished. Their final call came in at 11:45pm. Firefighters responded to a three-vehicle accident on the 3400 block of Highway 105. At this location, there were fluids leaking, so BFD members used dry absorbent on the spill, and cleaned the roadway off. As thrilling as the clatter of a roulette wheel or the swift flash of slot machines might be, casinos offer more than just games of chance. They host an array of events, each designed to provide an exciting and memorable experience for their patrons. This article delves into the intriguing world of casino events, providing a comprehensive overview of what they are, the different types available, and how they enrich the overall casino experience. Casino events are organized gatherings or activities held within casino premises. They often serve to attract new customers, entertain existing patrons, promote a specific game or service, or commemorate special occasions. From grand tournaments to live music performances, casino events add an extra layer of excitement and provide a more rounded entertainment experience. Regular tournaments are frequent events hosted by casinos. Players compete against each other in popular games like poker, slots, or blackjack for a chance to win big prizes. Tournaments often involve an entry fee and may take place over several days or weeks. Exclusive Casino Parties. Exclusive parties are lavish events thrown by the casino. These events often include a mix of gaming, live entertainment, food, and drinks. Some parties might be themed (like a “Roaring Twenties” night , while others are centered around holidays or other significant dates. Live Entertainment and Performances. Casinos regularly host live performances to entertain their guests. This can include live music, stand-up comedy, magic shows, or even circus performances. These shows offer a break from gaming and contribute to the overall entertainment experience. Promotional events are used by casinos to advertise new games, services, or features. They often include freebies, bonuses, or other incentives for attendees. Such events aim to draw in customers and get them excited about the casino’s latest offerings. Casino events significantly contribute to the excitement and allure of casinos. They provide diverse forms of entertainment, allowing patrons to enjoy more than just gaming. Such events also create a sense of community among attendees, fostering a more social atmosphere. Casino events, with their rich variety and excitement, play a pivotal role in the overall casino experience. They offer players an opportunity to enjoy different forms of entertainment, compete for substantial prizes, and socialize with other players. As we delve deeper into understanding the casino industry, the importance and impact of these events become even more apparent. So the next time you step into a casino, remember it’s not just about the games – there’s a whole world of thrilling events to discover! Your email address will not be published. Stories of Transformation Series Imagine facing months of financial struggle, battling depression and feeling like you’ve failed your loved ones. In the midst of such darkness, it is easy to lose hope and believe that there’s no way out. But let us introduce you to Eunice, a remarkable woman who discovered the transformative power of Jesus in her life. Through her encounter with Family Life Radio (FLR , Eunice found solace, support and a renewed sense of purpose. Discover how Jesus can transform your life too as you experience Eunice’s story. Hope in the Storm Eunice called to tell us her story. She faced the darkness head-on, battling financial hardships and the weight of failure. In her darkest moments, she found a lifeline through FLR and it became a catalyst for her transformation. “In the middle of my storm, I found God speaking to my soul. His presence changed my life completely,” Eunice shared. Her encounter with Jesus through FLR marked a turning point, a divine intervention that brought hope and healing when she needed it most. God’s Transformative Power Through her journey, Eunice experienced firsthand the incredible power of Jesus to transform lives. Reflecting on her experience, she said, “God could have used anything to save me, but He chose to use Family Life Radio. It was a lifeline that brought me hope and healing.” When you’re going through a difficult season, God’s Word can bring comfort like the promise found in Jeremiah 29:11, “For I know the plans I have for you,” declares the Lord, “plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.” God’s truth will be your anchor, assuring you that God has a purpose for your life, even in the midst of life’s most challenging circumstances. Support in Community Eunice’s journey was not one walked alone. Through Family Life Radio, she discovered a community of support that lifted her spirits and inspired her to persevere. Sharing her experience, Eunice says, “Together, we shared stories of how Jesus had transformed our lives. It was a reminder that I was not alone.” Psalm 34:17-18 says, “The righteous cry out, and the Lord hears them; he delivers them from all their troubles. The Lord is close to the brokenhearted and saves those who are crushed in spirit” (NIV . This verse can become a source of comfort, reminding you that God hears your cries, delivers you from your troubles and is near to you when you’re brokenhearted. Renewed Purpose With her faith in Jesus reignited, Eunice found a renewed purpose and joy in her life. She realized that her trucking business was not solely about financial stability but also an opportunity to spread God’s love and compassion. Eunice continued, “My faith in Jesus gave me a renewed sense of purpose. I realized that my business was not just about making money but about spreading God’s love and compassion to others.” 2 Corinthians 12:9-10 says, “But he said to me, ‘My grace is sufficient for you, for my power is made perfect in weakness.’ Therefore, I will boast all the more gladly about my weaknesses so that Christ’s power may rest on me” (NIV . In your most vulnerable moment, realize that it is through your weaknesses that Christ’s power is made perfect, and you can lean on His grace to carry you through the storms of life. Eunice said: As you embark on your own journey, may Eunice’s story inspire and encourage you. Just as Jesus transformed her life, He stands ready to transform yours. Open your heart to His love, find support in a community of faith and hold on to the promise that brighter days are ahead. Remember, you are not alone. Jesus is with you in the midst of your storm, ready to transform your life, bring hope to your heart and renew your purpose. Trust in Him, lean on His promises and allow His love to guide you through the challenges you face. The transformative power of Jesus is real, and it can change your life in ways you never thought possible. Want more? Check out our on demand resources. Family Life Radio is listener supported. Those who listen give to make the music and content possible to shine God’s love, peace and encouragement into hearts, revealing truths that direct people in the way they should go. Your dream home is more than just four walls and a roof; it embodies your vision, a place where your aspirations and lifestyle come to life. In the vibrant and diverse city of Portland, Oregon, the quest for the perfect custom home can be daunting, but with Stone Creek Building by your side, it becomes an exhilarating journey of creation. Craftsmanship That Sets Us Apart We have cultivated a legacy of excellence in custom home construction at Stone Creek Building. We are not just builders but artisans who take pride in every detail, from the foundation to the finishing touches. Our artisans are masters of their trade, ensuring that your home is built to the highest quality and durability standards. Your Vision, Our Blueprint One key element distinguishing us as the premier custom home builder in Portland is our unwavering commitment to translating your vision into a tangible reality. Our collaborative approach begins with deeply understanding your desires, preferences, and lifestyle. A custom home should be an extension of your personality and reflect your unique taste. Our team of architects and designers work closely with you, turning your ideas into architectural plans that capture your vision. Quality Meets Functionality In the world of custom home building, striking the balance between aesthetics and functionality is paramount. Stone Creek Building excels in this aspect. Our designs are visually stunning and practical, ensuring that every square foot of your home serves a purpose. Whether you seek an open-concept living space, a gourmet kitchen, or a tranquil backyard oasis, we ensure that your custom home fulfills your every need. Local Expertise, Global Inspiration Our deep roots in Portland, Oregon, provide us with an intimate knowledge of the city’s neighborhoods, architectural styles, and building regulations. We combine this local expertise with a global perspective, drawing inspiration from diverse architectural traditions and design trends. This fusion results in homes that are not only visually captivating but also harmonious with the local landscape. Sustainability and Innovation As a responsible custom home builder, Stone Creek Building strongly emphasizes sustainability and innovation. We incorporate eco-friendly materials and energy-efficient solutions into our designs. From energy-efficient HVAC systems to sustainable building materials, we ensure that your custom home is a testament to your style and a contribution to a greener future. Learn more about our commitment to sustainability here. A Partnership for a Lifetime Choosing Stone Creek Building as your custom home builder means entering into a partnership far beyond construction. We are committed to providing exceptional customer service, transparency, and a smooth building process from start to finish. Our goal is to meet and exceed your expectations, creating a custom home you’ll cherish for a lifetime. Explore our comprehensive services here. In conclusion, Stone Creek Building is more than just a custom home builder; we are your partners in crafting the home of your dreams. With a legacy of excellence, a commitment to quality, and a dedication to sustainability, we invite you to embark on the journey of a lifetime with us. Contact us today to start turning your vision into the masterpiece that is your custom home in the heart of Portland, Oregon. Your dream home awaits, and Stone Creek Building is here to make it a reality. Discover our remodeling services here and our ADU construction expertise here.

Chloe Vincente joined WDBJ 7 in February 2023 as an Anchor and Investigative Reporter. You can watch her weekdays, co-anchoring the 10 p.m. news on WZBJ and the 11 p.m. news on WDBJ. Chloe has a passion for investigative journalism. Before heading to Virginia, Chloe was an Investigative Reporter and Weekend Anchor at CBS 42 in Birmingham, Alabama. She helped her station launch its award-winning investigative franchise, ‘Your Voice Your Station.’ Her series on Birmingham’s Bluestone Coke plant won an Alabama Broadcaster’s Association award, after she uncovered the plant was operating with air quality violations. Prior to that, Chloe spent four years in the Southern Tier of New York, where she was a Main Evening Anchor at the CBS affiliate in Binghamton. She created an award-winning series called ‘Contaminated,’ where she investigated health hazards in the community. Her reports on dirty water in Endicott, NY led officials to invest in infrastructure upgrades, improving water quality for residents. Chloe was born and raised on the Connecticut shoreline. She graduated from the University of Connecticut with degrees in Journalism and Communications. In her free time, Chloe is an avid tennis player. She enjoys hiking, playing with her dog Lulu, and traveling. Chloe is also a major foodie and is excited to explore Roanoke’s restaurant scene! If you have a story idea, email Chloe at chloe.vincente@wdbj7.com. You can also connect with her on Instagram (bit.ly/3lFZ3QW , Facebook and Twitter. Yvonne Hale • 2월 4, 2023 Gel massage is a type of massage that uses a gel-like substance to enhance the massage experience. The gel is usually made of a water-based formula and is applied directly to the skin, providing a smooth and slippery surface for the therapist to work on. This type of massage is often used to provide a deeper and more intense massage, as the gel allows the therapist to apply more pressure and work on the muscles more effectively. Spa massage is a type of massage that is performed in a spa setting, typically for the purpose of relaxation and stress relief. Spa massage typically incorporates techniques from a variety of massage modalities, including Swedish, deep tissue, and hot stone massage, among others. Spa massages are often performed by licensed massage therapists who have received special training in spa techniques. Spa massages are typically performed in a quiet, relaxing environment, with the use of calming music, soft lighting, and soothing scents. They may also include the use of hot towels, aromatherapy oils, and other spa treatments to enhance the relaxation experience. The goal of spa massage is to help clients relax, reduce stress, and improve overall health and well-being. In conclusion, gel massage is a type of massage 안마사이트 that uses a gel-like substance to enhance the massage experience, while spa massage is a type of massage performed in a spa setting for relaxation and stress relief. Both types of massage can provide benefits for physical and mental well-being.

WASHINGTON– Gathering around the table for a Thanksgiving dinner won’t take as much of a toll on your pocketbook this year compared to 2022, but the meal still reflects historically high costs. The American Farm Bureau Federation’s 38th annual survey provides a snapshot of the average cost of this year’s classic holiday feast for 10, which is $61.17 or less than $6.20 per person. This is a 4.5% decrease from last year’s record-high average of $64.05, but a Thanksgiving meal is still 25% higher than it was in 2019, which highlights the impact high supply costs and inflation have had on food prices since before the pandemic. The field of dentistry is advancing in tandem with technology, ushering in transformative changes that improve both patient care and practice management. It s currently experiencing a notable shift, embracing innovations ranging from teledentistry and AI-driven diagnostics to the use of 3-D printing for personalized prosthetics. With these latest updates, dental professionals need to stay updated on these trends, to ensure they deliver care that is not only enhanced but also efficient and patient-centric. In this article, we ll cover the top eleven updates you can expect to see in today s practice management software. Recent strides in artificial intelligence (AI have ushered in a new era for dental practice management software. These advancements go beyond mere digitization, introducing automation to streamline routine administrative tasks. AI algorithms are now at the forefront, handling critical functions such as appointment scheduling, billing, and insurance claims processing. This infusion of AI not only alleviates the administrative burden on dental staff but also ensures a level of precision in practice management that was previously unparalleled. Modern dental practice management software extends beyond the realm of administrative efficiency to actively engage patients in their oral health journey. Patient portals, secure messaging systems, and automated appointment reminders are now standard features. These elements not only contribute to a heightened patient experience but also play a crucial role in improving compliance and, consequently, overall oral health outcomes. The advent of cloud-based dental practice management solutions represents a fundamental shift in how practitioners access and manage crucial information. These systems provide unprecedented flexibility, allowing practitioners to retrieve patient records, manage schedules, and access critical data from any location with internet connectivity. This move to the cloud streamlines internal workflows and fosters collaborative and coordinated care among dental team members. Dental practice management software suites like Adit ensure its users have every aspect of their clinics managed efficiently with a robust line-up of innovative tools that are accessible anywhere, anytime. Data-driven decision-making is a cornerstone of effective healthcare management, and dental offices are quick to adopt software with robust practice analytics and reporting features. Comprehensive dental practice management software empowers practitioners to delve into key performance indicators, track patient outcomes, and identify areas for improvement. This commitment to data-driven insights facilitates a culture of continuous enhancement in both clinical and operational aspects of dental care. Given the sensitivity of patient information, the latest updates in dental practice management software place a significant emphasis on security. Robust security protocols, including encrypted communication, multi-factor authentication, and regular security updates, are now integral features. These measures are designed to shield patient data from evolving cyber threats, ensuring a secure digital environment for all aspects of dental practice management. Interoperability stands as a crucial factor in the evolution of dental practice management software. The latest systems are designed to seamlessly integrate with other healthcare applications, such as electronic health records (EHRs and diagnostic tools. This interoperability ensures a smooth flow of information across the healthcare ecosystem, promoting enhanced coordination in patient care and facilitating a more holistic approach to healthcare management. A notable leap in technology within dental practice management software is the incorporation of sophisticated 3-D digital modeling capabilities. This innovative technology assists practitioners in comprehensive treatment planning by providing a highly accurate representation of oral structures. This visual tool not only aids in collaborative discussions between dental professionals and patients but also significantly enhances treatment communication and precision. Recognizing the demand for mobility, dental practice management software has embraced the integration of mobile applications. These apps empower practitioners to manage appointments, access patient records, and communicate with team members directly from their mobile devices. This on-the-go accessibility is a crucial feature, enhancing flexibility and responsiveness in dental practice management. The transition to paperless intake processes represents a substantial update in dental practice management software. By adopting customizable patient forms and electronic intake procedures, practices can significantly reduce paperwork, streamline administrative tasks, and contribute to a more efficient onboarding process for patients. This not only saves time for both patients and staff but also aligns with the growing trend toward sustainability and environmental consciousness within healthcare practices. One of the latest updates is the heightened focus on secure cloud-based solutions. Dental practices are leveraging secure cloud infrastructure to store and manage sensitive patient data. These cloud-based systems implement robust encryption, regular security audits, and data backup protocols, ensuring a high level of protection against unauthorized access and data breaches. The secure cloud not only enhances data security but also facilitates scalability and flexibility in dental practice management. The integration of digital X-rays is a crucial update in dental practice management software. Traditional film-based X-rays are being replaced by digital imaging, allowing for immediate access to high-quality images. This not only streamlines diagnostic processes but also reduces the environmental impact associated with traditional film-based radiography. Today s practice management software seamlessly integrates digital X-rays into patient records, providing a comprehensive and centralized view of a patient s oral health. As dental practices navigate the complexities of dentistry s digital metamorphosis, staying ahead of the latest updates in practice management software is crucial. From AI-driven automation and patient engagement features to secure cloud-based solutions, these advancements collectively shape a future where dental care is not only efficient and patient-centric but also secure in an increasingly interconnected healthcare landscape. In the dynamic world of dental care, staying current with technology is essential for providing efficient and patient-centric services. Dental Practice Management Software (DPMS is a critical tool for managing the myriad aspects of a dental practice. As advancements continue to reshape this landscape, it s imperative for dental professionals to assess whether their current software needs modernization. Here are key indicators that suggest it might be time for an upgrade: An outdated or clunky user interface can hinder productivity and frustrate users. If your dental software s interface feels antiquated and does not align with modern design principles, it might be a sign that an upgrade is necessary. Current practice management software like Adit offers intuitive interfaces, making navigation smoother for both administrative staff and clinicians. Interconnectedness is crucial in healthcare. If your current software struggles to integrate with other tools and systems, such as electronic health records (EHRs , diagnostic tools, or imaging systems, it may be hindering the seamless flow of information. Dental practice management software centralizes programming, allowing for streamlined communication and collaboration across various platforms. ATLANTA - Get ready to step into a magical world of wonder and excitement at the 2nd Annual Gala of The Sickle Cell Foundation of Georgia, Inc. (SCFG . With the theme of A Winter Wonderland, All for You,” this year s event promises to be a night of pure enchantment and joy.Join us on Saturday, December 2nd, at the exquisite Westin Atlanta Airport Hotel, 4736 Best Road near Hartsfield-Jackson International Airport, starting with a reception at 6:00 p.m. followed by dinner at 7:00 p.m. Tickets are available at www.sicklecellga.org/eventsThis annual event serves as a year in review of SCFG’s successes in the community and throughout the state, celebrates our clients living with sickle cell, and serves as a thank you to our many sponsors, donors, and doctors for their work in the sickle cell community.This year, be prepared to be entertained by the incredible voice of NBC s The Voice Runner Up, Ms. Jershika Maple, and be inspired by the wisdom of our keynote speaker, the distinguished Dr. Wayne A. I. Frederick, President Emeritus of Howard University. Dr. Frederick s extensive career in service to the sickle cell community has yielded valuable research and insights into physician education, effective communication, and physician-patient relationships.“We are tremendously honored to have Dr. Frederick because he is living with sickle cell disease and Living Well with Sickle Cell,” said SCFG Executive Director Tabatha McGee. “As a bonus, attendees can enter a drawing for one night’s stay at the fabulous Four Seasons Hotel Atlanta and other great prizes.”This elegant evening will feature a gourmet dinner and live entertainment. All proceeds from the event will go towards supporting research, education, hematology care, and advocacy for sickle cell disease.Our Gala is a celebration of our achievements in the community and a crucial step in raising awareness about sickle cell disease in Georgia.Sickle cell disease is a genetic blood disorder that affects millions of people worldwide. The disease is caused by a mutation in the hemoglobin gene, which results in the production of abnormal red blood cells. These abnormal red blood cells can sickle or become crescent-shaped, which can block blood flow and cause pain, organ damage, and other serious health problems.There is currently no cure for sickle cell disease, but there are treatments that can help manage the symptoms and improve quality of life. SCFG is committed to finding a cure for sickle cell disease and ensuring that all people affected have access to quality care.Marking our 52nd year of existence, SCFG advocates for over 14,000 Georgians living with sickle cell. SCFG offers affordable, mobile, and in-person hematology services, sickle cell testing, specialized care coordination, educational opportunities, and food assistance. SCFG also hosts Camp New Hope, Georgia’s first and most popular medically supervised summer camp. Take advantage of this incredible, unforgettable evening - get your tickets now at www.sicklecellga.org/events! Indulge in our cakes for every occasion. Visit us online at MidtownCakes.com The Columbus Times © All rights reserved.

The sudden, unannounced departure of Florida A&M University’s long-time police chief, Terrence Calloway, has left the community puzzled and seeking answers. As speculation runs rampant, the university’s reluctance to provide substantial information about Calloway’s change in status has only fueled the curiosity surrounding the situation. Calloway, who served as the FAMU police chief for over a decade, starting his career with the university in June of 2013 with a salary of more than $152,000, was widely respected for his dedication to campus safety and fostering positive relationships with the student body. His sudden absence has left a void in the university’s law enforcement and has raised concerns among students and faculty. Despite the significant impact of Calloway’s departure, FAMU has remained tight-lipped about the circumstances surrounding his exit. The university’s lack of transparency has led to various theories and rumors circulating within the community, further deepening the mystery. One prevailing theory suggests Calloway’s departure may be linked to an ongoing internal investigation. However, neither FAMU nor any official sources have confirmed or denied this speculation. This silence has only heightened the confusion and frustration among those seeking answers. The absence of a straightforward narrative has also sparked concerns regarding the university’s commitment to transparency and accountability. FAMU, known for its strong sense of community, has always prided itself on open communication and trust between its administration and stakeholders. However, the current situation challenges this reputation. FAMU spokesman Andrew Skerritt said by email, “…there is no comment from the university.” The uncertainty surrounding Calloway’s departure has also sparked discussions about the importance of transparency within educational institutions. As FAMU strives to maintain its reputation as a leading institution, will it address these concerns and provide the community with the information it deserves?

Quantum computing is a new technology that is set to revolutionize the way we think about computing. Traditional computers rely on a binary system of ones and zeros to perform calculations, but quantum computers use quantum bits, or qubits, which can exist in multiple states simultaneously. This enables quantum computers to perform calculations exponentially faster than traditional computers, making them ideal for solving complex problems that are beyond the capabilities of classical computers. The potential applications of quantum computing are vast and varied. For example, quantum computers could be used to optimize supply chains, develop new materials, and simulate complex biological systems. They could also be used to solve optimization problems that are difficult or impossible to solve with classical computers, such as the traveling salesman problem or the knapsack problem. One of the most exciting aspects of quantum computing is its potential to revolutionize cryptography. Traditional encryption methods rely on the difficulty of factoring large numbers, but quantum computers are able to solve this problem in a matter of minutes. This means that quantum computers could potentially break many of the encryption methods that are currently used to secure online transactions, emails, and other sensitive data. However, quantum computers could also be used to develop new encryption methods that are immune to attacks by classical computers. Despite its enormous potential, quantum computing is still in its early stages of development. Quantum computers are notoriously difficult to build and operate, and they require specialized knowledge and expertise. However, major tech companies such as IBM, Google, and Microsoft are investing heavily in quantum computing research, and many experts predict that quantum computers will become more widely available in the coming years.

Granimator requires a minimum deposit of $250 to start trading.
